title: Ticket #7336: Allow condor_submit to take multiple submit files
description: LIGO hit a problem where they want to run condor_submit once and submit multiple jobs with different universes. We can't do this in one submit file today, but LIGO would like to be able to run condor_submit once, passing in multiple independent submit files.
remarks:
2019-Oct-22 16:06:42 by johnkn:

The easiest way to do this would be to allow multiple instances of the -file argument, and have all other arguments apply to all of the files specified. All files would be submitted as a single transaction.

In particular, this would mean -append would append to all files, -queue would set the same queue statement for all files, and arguments of the form key=value would prefix key=value before each file.

each file would otherwise be parsed separately and each would be assigned a separate cluster id (more than one if executable changes within the file - at least until we remove that behavior)

This is not necessarily the best design however.

2019-Dec-03 10:48:21 by pfc:
Lacking a technical requirement for running condor_submit once vs multiple times, I'm bumping this down to priority=4.
